medical_history.chief_complaint: Vague mid-abdominal pain of a colicky nature.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began about 1 day ago. The patient experienced colicky abdominal pain, an episode of clear non-bilious non-bloody emesis, and 2 loose bowel movements. The pain persisted, leading the patient to seek evaluation, suspecting ketoacidosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Type I diabetes mellitus, uncontrolled (last HbA1c 10.8). Complicated by gastroparesis and nephropathy. 2. Erosive gastritis per EGD. Noncompliant with GI follow-up. 3. Hypertension, uncontrolled. 4. Chronic renal insufficiency, baseline 1.5. 5. Gastroesophageal reflux disease. 6. Depression.
medical_history.family_history: Mr. ___ has 4 brothers and 5 sisters, all with no known history of diabetes or significant medical problems. His parents are alive and well. His grandfather had an unspecified condition.
